# characteristicType

**Instance Property**

The type of the characteristic.

## Declaration

```swift
var characteristicType: String { get }
```

## Discussion

A characteristic’s [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristic/characteristicType] is a string constant that tells you what the characteristic’s [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristic/value] represents. For example, if you detect a characteristic type of [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristicTypeCurrentTemperature], then you know that the corresponding [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristic/value] is a measure of the current temperature.

```swift
if characteristic.characteristicType == HMCharacteristicTypeCurrentTemperature,
    let temperatureValue = (characteristic.value as? NSNumber)?.floatValue {
        
    let temperature = String(format: "%.1f", temperatureValue)
    print("The current temperature is \(temperature) °C")
}
```

From the type, you can typically infer the value’s format. The value for the current temperature is always a floating point number measured in degrees Celsius, as shown in the code snippet above. You can also use the characteristic’s [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristic/metadata] to get explicit and detailed guidance on how to format the value.

See [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/characteristic-types] for a list of standard types.

## Determining what a characteristic controls

- **Characteristic types**: The characteristic types supported by HomeKit-based accessories.
